description: The holiday season is finally here, and what better way to celebrate than with a Gingerbread Eggnog Recipe? This recipe has all the flavors of Christmas: ginger, cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves. The eggnog has a sweet taste that will make your mouth water for more!
name: Gingerbread Eggnog
recipeIngredient: ¼ tsp. Freshly grated nutmeg, plus more for serving
¾ cup to 1 cup Dark rum, Cognac, Bourbon, or a combination

recipeInstructions.name: Cook the heavy cream, ginger, vanilla, cloves, allspice, cinnamon, nutmeg, and 2 cups milk on medium heat until simmering.
recipeInstructions.text: Cook the heavy cream, ginger, vanilla, cloves, allspice, cinnamon, nutmeg, and 2 cups milk on medium heat until simmering.

recipeInstructions.name: Let it simmer for 2 to 3 minutes before removing from heat and let sit for 30 minutes.
recipeInstructions.text: Let it simmer for 2 to 3 minutes before removing from heat and let sit for 30 minutes.

recipeInstructions.name: Beat the egg yolks and gradually add sugar and salt. Resume mixing until pale and thick.
recipeInstructions.text: Beat the egg yolks and gradually add sugar and salt. Resume mixing until pale and thick.

recipeInstructions.name: Strain the spiced cream mixture and discard the spices. Return the mixture to the pot.
recipeInstructions.text: Strain the spiced cream mixture and discard the spices. Return the mixture to the pot.

recipeInstructions.name: Whisk 1 cup of warm water into the yolk-sugar mix at low speed. Cook over medium heat and constantly stir for 12 to 15 minutes.
recipeInstructions.text: Whisk 1 cup of warm water into the yolk-sugar mix at low speed. Cook over medium heat and constantly stir for 12 to 15 minutes.

recipeInstructions.name: Place the pot in a bowl with ice water to let cool and occasionally stir until it chills. Pour in the rum, cognac, or bourbon and the remaining 2 cups of milk.
recipeInstructions.text: Place the pot in a bowl with ice water to let cool and occasionally stir until it chills. Pour in the rum, cognac, or bourbon and the remaining 2 cups of milk.

recipeInstructions.name: Beat another batch of egg whites until soft. Fold into the eggnog and serve topped with nutmeg.
